å¦‚æœå¤§å®¶è¦ºå¾—å²©ç”¨ å¯ä»¥è‡ªå·±ç•¥åŠ ä¿®æ”¹ ç„¶å¾Œspread å„åœ‹å‚³åª’ 9æœˆ9 æˆ‘åœ°ç„¡å¾—å†è¼¸

No, HK people did not win after Carrie Lam's video address today. Carrie Lam is fooling HK people and every foreigner again.

Let's have a look:-

According to Carrie Lam's video address today, she mention that

"First, the Government will formally withdraw the bill in order to fully allay public concerns. The Secretary for Security will move a motion according to the Rules of Procedure when the Legislative Council resumes."

Please note that it is only "MOVE A MOTION".

Secondly, according to RULES OF PROCEDURE--PROCEDURE ON BILLS point 64:

"The Member or public officer in charge of a bill may, by announcement in Council at the beginning of proceedings for its second or third reading, withdraw or postpone the bill."

That's mean the HK government can simply announce the withdrawal the bill instead of moving a motion on the withdrawal.

The reason for this trick is that the pro-government legislative council(Legco) members occupied more than a half of chairs in the legco. And any government bill could be rejected if there are more than half of the legco members opposing it. So, when the time of the Secretary of Security Bureau move the withdrawal motion, if most, if not all, pro-government party members said no to the motion, the bill would have been resurrected.

So she DID NOT response any demand from HK people. We keep fighting until all the demands are met. Please stand with HK people.

Carrie Lam's video message on 4/9:
https://www.news.gov.hk/eng/2019/09/20190904/20190904_171611_600.html

Rule of Procedure on procedure on bill from Legco:
https://www.legco.gov.hk/yr99-00/english/procedur/content/partk.htm
